item.title: Powerminer problem
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

I was reading through and I found why AntiRandoms wasn’t working, You did it once then waited for like 4 seconds, You should do something like:
[scar]
procedure mineRock;
var
a, b, Waited: Integer;
begin
repeat
if(findColorSpiralTolerance(x, y, rockColor, 0, 0, 764, 502, rockTol))Then
begin
MMouse(x, y, 5, 5);
getMousePos(x, y);
if(isUpText(‘Mine’))Then
begin
wait(50+random(50));
Mouse(x, y, 3, 3, true);
Writeln(‘Mining…’);
getMousePos(a, b);
MarkTime(Waited);
Repeat
FindPick;
FindNormalRandoms;
FindGas(a, b);
if(findGas(a, b))Then
begin
Writeln(‘Found gas!’);
end;
Wait(300+Random(300)); //To prevent total laggage of your comp
Until((TimeFromMark(Waited)>=WaitT+random(1000)));
end;
end;
until(invFull);
if(invFull)Then
begin
dropOres;
end;
end;[/scar]
You also need SetUpSRLMining; in your script.

Read full topic

That lag thing is most likely FindNormalRandoms because it uses FindBitmapMaskTolerance, Which makes your comp lag

item.title: Powerminer problem
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

I don’t mean this to be rude, I just disagree.

See, I had more waits in at first, before the click part, so the script would find the rock, but a few times by the time it got to the click procedure, the rock had already been mined, so I took those waits out and if I add more waits after the click procedure, it would make the wait time variable innaccurate to the user, although not a big deal, and 4-5 seconds isn’t that short, all the mineRock does is find the rock, wich doesn’t take long at all, then moves the mouse there(1 second), checks for the mine text(barely takes up any time at all) and then clicks and waits.

I guess I went a little in depth there, lol, anyways, I ran into a problem with the anti-randoms. They don’t seem to work… does anyone know if there’s something I’m doing wrong? Do I need to add a procedure for fights, and the nick name bmp part doesn’t seem to find the nick, when a dwarf popped up, it just ignored it.

Once again, thanks for the help with this, its only my second script so I haven’t used SRL before :rolleyes:.

Read full topic

item.title: Powerminer problem
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Hey, I’m making a powerminer, but its a simple one.

Heres the code
[scar]{
Welcome to Weib’s Powerminer!

----FEATURES----

  1. Mines the rock specified and once your inventory is full, it drops
    everything but the picks.
  2. This script will not drop your picks, no matter how many you have
    in your inventory, assuming that you filled out the ‘picks’ const
    correctly and have your picks in the very first slots.
  3. Mines until it meets your requirement of loads :).
  4. Includes anti-randoms!
  5. The script checks for randoms halfway through the dropping procedure,
    just incase a mysterious old man decides to pop in while you’re
    dropping!

----SETUP----

  1. Have picks in first inventory slot (Not sure if you can equip pick or
    not, don’t know if the script will attach the head to an equipped pick
    if it falls off).
  2. Start in any mining place.
  3. Additional setup on lines 35-40.

----OTHER INFO----
This script was made by me, Weibs.
Help with functions
}
program weibsPowerMiner;
procedure dropOres; forward;
{.include SRL/SRL.scar}
{.include SRL/SRL/skill/mining.scar}

const

////SETUP HERE!
rockColor=4351886;//The color of the rock you wish to mine.
rockTol=2;//The color tolerance, 0-2 recommended, any higher and the script may not find the rock.
picks=1;//However many picks you have in your inventory. Do not count equipped picks.
waitT=4000;//The amount of time the script should wait before clicking a rock again. In milliseconds.
Nick=‘hopp’;//3-4 letters of your username (My username is Choppermccut) Case sensitive.
loadsToDo=50;//Number of loads to do before ending script.
//END SETUP!

var
loads: Integer;

procedure mineRock;
var
a, b: Integer;
begin
repeat
if(findColorSpiralTolerance(x, y, rockColor, 0, 0, 764, 502, rockTol))Then
begin
MMouse(x, y, 5, 5);
getMousePos(x, y);
if(isUpText(‘Mine’))Then
begin
wait(50+random(50));
Mouse(x, y, 3, 3, true);
Writeln(‘Mining…’);
getMousePos(a, b);
FindPick;
FindNormalRandoms;
FindGas(a, b);
if(findGas(a, b))Then
begin
Writeln(‘Found gas!’);
end;
wait(waitT+random(1000));
end;
end;
until(invFull);
if(invFull)Then
begin
dropOres;
end;
end;

procedure dropOres;
begin
dropTo(picks+1,15);
findNormalRandoms;
dropTo(16,28);
loads:=loads+1;
end;

begin
activateClient;
setupSRL;
NickNameBMP:=CreateBitmapMaskFromText(Nick, UpChars);
FindPickHeadColor;
repeat
mineRock;
until(loads=loadsToDo);
end.[/scar]

I ran it and it works for the most part, but the one problem I’ve found, is that at some point it lags just long enough for my guy to log out. It might just be my comp, but I think it has something to do with the script, considering whenever I run scar on runescape it lags. Any help would be appreciated, and please comment if there’s anything I can do to make the anti randoms and anti ban better.

Also, does anybody know if you need to add something to run away from a fight? I think I saw that somewhere, it was something like this…
[scar]if(fightFound)Then
begin
runAway(n);
wait(5000+random(1000));
runBack;
end;[/scar]

Thanks in advance!

-Weibs

Read full topic
